headline: Classic hierarchy structure. Do not expect too much if you are in the lowest rank of a team
status:
18 November 2019

3.0
★★★★★
Former Employee
pros: N/A would be my response
cons:
Classic hierarchy structure.
Given your rank, everything is "confidential" to you. You will be assigned tasks but you cannot ask into detail about the tasks.
Given your rank, nobody cares if you do the tasks well.

headline: An easy, fun job for undergraduates
status:
28 October 2019
"An easy, fun job for undergraduates"
4.0
★★★★★
Current Employee
pros: The tasks aren't that difficult, basically you have to introduce HKMA to visitors and some filing work. The working culture isn't too stressful and there is a recreational day for all workers to relieve stress after a month of work.
cons: There is not much to learn as a student ambassador, the job may not be suitable for students who would like to know how to work in a government office.

headline: Student Ambassador
pros: The brand name is pretty good I would say but not very helpful in job searching.
cons: The duties are tedious and you have to memorize a 45 min script for offering guided tours to the visitors, hard work and effort needed which is pretty unparalleled with the salary.
advice_to_mgmt: Increase the hourly pay from $55/hr, it's pretty low, to be honest.

headline: Excellent Welfare
pros:
Offer systematic training to interns
Very good welfare for regular staff: subsidises continual education, lenient healthcare and pension plan
Able to enjoy some of the best office facilities in Hong Kong
cons: Can involve in tedious works like filing documents and making print copies, but still it's a nice chance for first or second year university students to experience how it's like to work in HKMA
advice_to_mgmt: The company's lenient compensation and benefits policies not only encourage the employees to stay, but have also build up a strong morale among them. Keep up with the good job!

headline: Assistant Manager
pros: Hours are good. Training is good.
cons: Promotion and appraisal are opague.

headline: Summer intern
pros: fixed working hours, no overtime
cons: repetitive job, less learning opportunities

headline: Summer Intern
pros: Colleagues are helpful and friendly. Office location is great with wonderful view. Moderate amount of work load and there are some lessons for interns.
cons: The structure of the intern program is incomplete. Experience varies a lot in different departments. Some department might not offer much interesting exposures.
advice_to_mgmt: More information prior to the employment, there should be more information about the nature of work of different departments for our considerations.

headline: Steep learning curve; rewarding
pros:
1) Got to conduct real tasks in empirical economic analyses. Graduated learning in graduate-level econometrics and programming. No coffee boy here.
2) Highly educated colleagues who are versatile and enthusiastic about their work
3) Good working hours for interns
cons: If you haven't done econometrics before, work could be tough.
advice_to_mgmt: More events for interns are always appreciated.

headline: Poor career prospect
pros: It is a stable job, with decent salary. Suitable for people with a family. The colleagues are friendly in general. The office building is also nice.
cons: There is very little room to move up. Many people stay in the same rank for a decade or even longer. If you are lucky, you will become a Senior Manager in your 40s or 50s, but that is pretty much the end of your career.

headline: Salary
pros: Friendly boss in work place.
cons: Bored work and without sense of achievement

headline: Retirement job
pros: Excellent sea view office in Central.
cons: Usual government bureaucracy, self-censoring culture
